page.title: 05NOTABLE EVENTS
page.content: The hamlet of Bailey Lane End, which is on the periphery of the Royal Forest of Dean, have a small Methodist Church whose members organize an Annual Musical Festival in July which attracts competitors from a wide area. Usually one week later they hold their Annual Fete.During the Summer these Methodists hold Open Air Religious Services and the one on The Dancing Green aided by the Band of the Hereford Salvation Army is very well attended. The Lea Parish Church is the venue for 6 Concerts during the Year when local Choirs and Brass Bands with Guest Soloists give a very appreciated programme. The Annual Road Race between Rank Xerox, Mitcheldean and Ross-on-Wye inspires wisdom strength and beauty.
